title: The One With Two Parts, Part 2

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: An Emergency Room, Rachel and Monica enter.  Rachel is limping and leaning
on Monica for support.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow ow. Ow ow ow. Ow. Ow. Ow. Ow.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi. Uh, my friend here was taking down our Christmas lights, and and she fell off the balcony and may have broken her foot or or ankle or something.

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: My god. You still have your Christmas lights up?

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Fill this out and bring it back to me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, ooh, alright. Name, address... Okay, in case of emergency, call?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that is so sweet. (Touched, she puts an arm around her friend and kisses her.) Oh gosh, love you. Insurance?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, check it. Definitely, I want some of that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (No longer touched) you don't have insurance?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why, how much is this gonna cost?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I have no idea, but X-rays alone could be a couple hundred dollars.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wel-wel-well what are we gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well there's not much we can do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Like a big baby) Um... unless, unless I use yours.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hah, no no no no no no no no no no.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Tapping the clipboard) well, now, wait a second, who did I just put as my "In case of emergency" person?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Looking around to check that no-one's listening, then lowering her voice anyway) That's insurance fraud.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, alright, then, forget it. (Getting up to go) Might as well just go home. Ow ow ow ow!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Jumping up to make Rachel sit down) Okay, okay. I hate this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you. Thank you. I love you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to the nurse) Hi, (tiny laugh) um, I'm gonna need a new set of (tiny laugh) these forms (tiny laugh).

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Tiny laugh) I am really an idiot. (Tiny laugh) you see, I was filling out my friend's form, and instead of putting her information, (tiny laugh) I put mine.

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: You are an idiot. (She hands over a blank form).

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Tiny laugh) yep, that's me, (tiny laugh) I am that stupid (tiny laugh).

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, has split up his newspaper so Joey can look at the
funnies, while Ross's inappropriate joke at Lamaze class has come back to haunt him.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I had a dream last night where I was playing football with my kid.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: That's nice.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, with him. (He mimes holding the baby like a football.) I'm on this field, and they, they hike me the baby... and I, I know I've gotta do something 'cause the Tampa Bay defence is comin' right at me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Tampa Bay's got a terrible team.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Right, but, it is just me and the baby, so I'm thinkin' they can take us. And so I uh, hah-hah, I just heave it down field.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you crazy? That's a baby!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He should take the sack?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Anyway, suddenly I'm down field, and I realise that I'm the one who's supposed to catch him, right? Only I know there is no way I'm gonna get there in time, so I am running, and running, and that, that is when I woke up. See I, I am so not ready to be a father.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, you're gonna be fine. You're one of the most caring, most responsible men in North America. You're gonna make a great dad.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, Ross. You and the baby just need better blocking.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, have either one of you guys ever been to the Rainbow Room? Is it real expensive?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, only if you order stuff.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm takin' Ursula tonight. It's her birthday.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wo-wo-whoa. What about Phoebe's birthday?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: When's that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Tonight.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, man. What're the odds of that happening?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You take your time.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: There it is! So what're you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What can I do? Look, I don't want to do anything to screw it up with Ursula.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And your friend Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, if she's my friend, hopefully she'll understand. I mean, wouldn't you guys?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Man, if you tried something like that on my birthday, you'd be starin' at the business end of a hissy fit.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, Monica and Rachel are waiting for the doctors to arrive.  
They enter and are played by Noah Wyle and George Clooney.]

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: ..you add a pinch of saffron, it makes all the difference.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: Okay, errrr, Monica?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes? (jumping as Rachel punches her arm) ..yes, she is.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL (AS MONICA)
dialogue.text: Hi, this is my friend Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA (AS RACHEL)
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: (Smiling) Hi, err Rachel. I'm Dr.Mitchell.

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: (Smiling even more and attempting to take over) And I'm his friend, Dr.Rosen.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Aren't you a little cute to be a doctor?

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: Excuse me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I meant er, (struggling to concentrate) young, young, I meant young, young to be a doctor. Oh good, Rach.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA (AS RACHEL)
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL (AS MONICA)
dialogue.text: Right.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone but Joey is waiting for Phoebe to arrive for her
surprise birthday party.  Rachel and Monica is telling Chandler about Rachel's
incident.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ..so, he said it was just a sprain, and that was it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, you left out the stupid part.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Not stupid. The very cute, cute, cute doctors asked us out for tomorrow night, and I said "yes."

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think it's totally insane, I mean, they work for the hospital. It's like returning to the scene of the crime. You know, I say we blow off the dates.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? Monica, they are cute, they are doctors, (spelling it out in the air for her slow friend) cute doctors, doctors who are cute!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, what have we learned so far?

dialogue.speaker: THE WHOLE PARTY
dialogue.text: (Jumping up) SURPRISE!!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What the hell are you doing? You scared the crap outta me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Was that the cake?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. I got a lemon schmush.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on, she'll be here any minute.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I hope it's okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Reading) "Happy Birthday Peehe."

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well maybe we can make a, a, a 'B' out of one of those roses.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Still annoyed) Yeah, we'll just use our special cake tools.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, we just...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE'S FRIENDS
dialogue.text: (Finally noticing the guest of honour) Surprise!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Delighted) oh, oh, oh! This is so great! Oh my god! This was not at all scary. Hi everybody. Hi Betty! Betty, Hi! (Thrilled) You found Betty! Oh my god! (Hugging people) This is great. Everybody I love is in the same room, (still happy) Where's Joey?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Did you see Betty?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: A Restaurant, Ross is having lunch with his father who is examining his next
forkful.]

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I tell you one thing, I wouldn't mind having a piece of this sun-dried tomato business. Five years ago, if somebody had said to me, here's a tomato that looks like a prune, I'd say "get out of my office!"

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Dad, before I was born, did you freak out at all?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I'm not freaking out, I'm just saying, if somebody had come to me with the idea andndash;

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Dad, dad, dad, I'm talkin' about the whole uh, baby thing. Did you uh, ever get this sort of... panicky, "Oh my god I'm gonna be a father" kind of a thing?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: No. Your mother really did the work. I was busy with the business. I wasn't around that much. Is that what this is about?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, Dad, I was just wondering.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: 'Cause there's time to make up for that. We can do stuff together. You always wanted to go to that Colonial Williamsburg. How 'bout we do that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks, Dad, really, I ju... you know, I just, I just needed to know, um... when did you start to feel like a father?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Oh, well, I, I guess it musta been the day after you were born. We were in the hospital room, your mother was asleep, and they brought you in and gave you to me. You were this ugly little red thing, and all of a sudden you grabbed my finger with your whole fist. And you squeezed it, so tight. And that's when I knew.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: So you don't wanna go to Williamsburg?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, we can go to Williamsburg.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Eat your fish.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is just getting off of the intercom and turns off
the TV which is still in the SAP mode.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, the cute doctors are here.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering from her room) Okay, coming!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi, come on in.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi, Geoffrey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: Ah here, we brought wine.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: Look at this, it's from the cellars of Ernest and Tova Borgnine, so how could we resist?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that's great. Look at that.

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: So, Monica, how's the ankle?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's uh...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA (AS RACHEL)
dialogue.text: ..well, why don't you tell them? After all it, is your ankle.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL (AS MONICA)
dialogue.text: You know what, it's feeling a lot better, thank you, um... Well, listen, why don't you two sit down and, and we'll get you some glasses... okay... (They don't know what to do with their coats and Monica points to the living room) STAT!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, listen, I'm thinking, why don't we just tell them who we really are? I mean, it'll be fine, I really think it'll be fine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It will not be fine. We'll get in trouble.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Monica! Would you stop being such a wuss ?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: A wuss? Excuse me for living in the real world, okay?

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: So?

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: So... they sss-still seem normal.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: That's because they are.

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: (Nervously) okay, but you have to admit that every time we go out... Women we meet at the hospital... It turns into...

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: Willya relax? Look around. No pagan altars, no piles of bones in the corners, they're fine. (Baring his teeth to clean them with his finger) Go like this. (Dr. Rosen obeys.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I said we are not going to do it, okay? Sometimes you can be such a, a big baby.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Resenting the truth) I am not a baby! You know what? I swear to god, just because you get so uptight every time we...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sure, every time, you're such a princess...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You know what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You know what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You know what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (getting angry) What!!?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Every day, you are becoming more and more like your mother.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello! Here we go!

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: This is a great place. How long have you lived here?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Thanks! I've been here about six years, and Rachel moved in a few months ago.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Yeah... (joining the others) ..see, I was supposed to get married, but, um, I left the guy at the altar.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Yeah... Yeah, I know it's pretty selfish, but haha, hey, that's me. (Indicating a dish on the table) Why don't you try the hummus?

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: So, Monica, what do you do?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Aahh, I'm a... chef at a restaurant uptown.

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: Good for you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Yeah it is, mostly because I get to boss people around, which I just love to do.

dialogue.speaker: DR. ROSEN
dialogue.text: This hummus is great.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: God bless the chickpea.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) (Suddenly laughing) Oh, god, I am so spoiled... That's it!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) And by the way, have I mentioned that back in high school, I was a cow?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) I used to wet my bed.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) I use my breasts to get other people's attention.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) (Revealing her anger to point at her best friend) We both do that!

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: (on the phone) Monica and Rachel's apartment. Err yeh, aayah, yeh, just one second... (handing it to Monica) ..ah, Rachel, it's your dad.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Hi, Dad. No, no, it's me. (Getting up to move further away from Rachel) li-listen, Dad, I can't talk right now, um, but there's something, um... there's something that I've been meaning to tell you...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Would you excuse me for a second?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Remember back in freshman year? (Talking fast before Rachel can catch her) Well, Billy Dreskin and I had sex on your bed.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Ross, Phoebe, Chandler and Monica sit
round the coffee table, playing Scrabble. Rachel, still in her dressing gown, is pleading
on the phone, her free hand shaking with agitation.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Daddy... Daddy... Daddy, why whyyy would I sleep with Billy Dreskin? His father tried to put you out of business! (Rachel turns to Monica, clasping the receiver to her bosom so Dr.Green can't hear, while mouthing "You are...") ...dead!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross, he's got the remote again.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Good. Maybe he can switch it back.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Maybe not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello? (Listens) Um, yeah, uh, (snapping her fingers at Ross who takes the remote from Marcel, then turns off the TV) Okay ah, hold on a second, lemme lemme just check and see if see if she's here.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It's the woman from the hospital admissions office. She says there's a problem with the form. Oh, god, oh god...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh god, waddawe do, waddawe do, waddawe do?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't know! Why don't you just explain? What do they want? Find out what they want!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay (desperately hands the receiver over) no, you do it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (taking the phone) Hello, this is Monica... Yeah??? Oh... (Smiles at Rachel to reassure her) Okay, yes, we'll be right, we'll be right down.(Listens) Thank you. (Hangs up)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We forgot to sign one of the admissions forms.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohhh... (slumping in relief) Okay, you were right. You were right! This was just not worth it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, let me just change.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering quietly) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Trouble?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Your sister stood me up the other night.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, no. Don't you hate it when people aren't there for you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well did you try calling her ?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I've been trying for two days. When I called the restaurant, they said she was too busy to talk. I can't believe she's blowin' me off.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Riff's, Phoebe is entering. Ursula returns with two plates of chicken, but she
only has time to set one on the table, when...]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um you, you got a minute?

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Um, yeah, I'm just... (waving dismissively at the concept) ..working.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, oh, I got you a birthday present.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Oh, wow! You remembered! (Opening it) Oh! It's a Judy Jetson thermos!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Right, like the kind you...

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Right... Oh, I got something for you, too.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How'd you know I was coming?

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Um, yeah, um, twin thing.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can't believe you did this.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I can't believe you... (holding up Joey's cardigan) ..did this.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So... What's the deal with umm, you and Joey?

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Oh, right. He is so great. But that's over.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Does he know ?

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Joey. You know, um, he's really nutsy about you.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: He is? Why?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You got me.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Excuse me. Doesn't this come with a side salad?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So, um, are you gonna call him?

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: What? (Indicating the departing waiter) Do you think he likes me?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, Joey .

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: Oh. No, no, he is so smart. He'll figure it out. (Offering to share her food) Do you want some chicken?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No. No food with a face.

dialogue.speaker: URSULA
dialogue.text: You have not changed!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, you too.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Emergency Room. The officious admissions nurse is again on duty. Rachel and
Monica enter, looking worried. As they approach the desk, Rachel adopts a winning smile,
while Monica struggles to smile at all.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Hi, remember us?

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: (Grimacing) Mmm hmmm.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Um, okay. You just called a little while ago about needing a signature on the admissions form. Well, it turns out we need a whole new one (little laugh) because uh, you see, I-I, I put the wrong name again. (Little laugh) 'cause um...

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: You're that stupid.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) I am. I'm that stupid. (Little laugh.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Yeah, and and, I'm just gonna pay for this with a check.

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Well, you know your insurance will cover that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Yeah, I know... (mirroring her friend) ..I'm I'm just not that bright either.

scenes.location:
The Emergency Room. The officious admissions nurse is again on duty. Rachel and
Monica enter

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is neglecting the game of Scrabble , for
he's busily drawing on his own childhood in an attempt to help Ross. Marcel chitters
about.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, worst case scenario. Say you never feel like a father.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Say your son never feels connected to you, as one. Say all of his relationships are affected by this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Do you have a point?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, you think I would.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What's up with the simian?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's just a fur ball.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay... (returning to the board) ..whose turn is it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yours, I just got 43 points for 'KIDNEY'.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, you got zero points for 'IDNEY'.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I had a 'K'. Where's where's my 'K'?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Emergency Room, Monica sits with Rachel, who is filling out an honest form
at last. Ross and Chandler hurtle in. Little Marcel, wrapped in a fluffy towel, is cradled
in Ross's arms. They dash up to the admissions desk. Ross is frantic.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You've got to help me my monkey swallowed a 'K'!

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: (angrily) You go get that animal outta here .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no you don't understand the animal hospital is way across town he's choking I don't know what else to do.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's goin' on?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Marcel swallowed a Scrabble tile.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Excuse me... This hospital is for people!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Lady, he is people. He has a name, okay? He watches Jeopardy! He he touches himself when nobody's watching. Please, please have a heart!

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: I'll take a look at him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Michael.

dialogue.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogue.text: Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Monica.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (as Rachel) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (as Monica) Hi.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is playing "She Loves Me, She Loves Me Not" with
the petals of a flower, alternately looking hopeful and annoyed. Phoebe enters, but not as
herself, for she has changed the style of her hair and make-up to match that of her twin
sister. She hangs up her coat, revealing her new cardigan. Nervously, she smooths out the
identifying garment, approaching Joey who sits next to the main sofa.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Urse...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ..ah, what're you doing here? I've been trying to call you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) Listen, um...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no, no, don't say "listen." I know that "listen." I've said that "listen."

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't get it. What happened? What about everything you said under the bridge?

dialogue.speaker: AS URSULA)
dialogue.text: Yeah, um... (nervously clears her throat) You know you, you should just forget about what I said under the bridge, I was talkin' crazy that night, I was so drunk!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You don't drink.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) That's right, I don't... But I was, I was drunk on you!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, Urse... (He tries to take her in his arms, but she fends him off.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) Okay, yeah, so it's not gonna work.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why? Is it because I'm friends with Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) If it was, would you stop hanging out with her?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Thinking carefully) no. No, I, I couldn't do that.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) Um, then yes, it's 'cause of Phoebe! So, you know, it's either her or me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Then, uh, then I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as Ursula) You know... (unconsciously putting a hand on his knee) You're gonna be really, really hard to get over.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I know...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know whether it's just 'cause we're breakin' up or... what, but you have never looked so beautiful.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Automatically) Yeah. Oooh... (she's sprung.)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, Marcel lies on the operating table while recovering from the
anaesthetic, tucked up under a sheet like an infant in a huge bed. Ross sits beside him,
as a smiling Chandler, Monica and Rachel look on.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He looks so tiny.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We just got the message.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Is he alright?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. The doctor got the 'K' out. He also found an 'M' and an 'O'.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We think he was trying to spell out 'MONKEY.'

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, the doctor says he's gonna be fine, he's just sleeping now.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Tapping Ross on his shoulder) So, you feel like a dad yet?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, why?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, come on, you came through, you did what you had to do. That is very dad.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, look, he's waking up!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Quietly) hey, fella! How you doing?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone except Joey is there.  Rachel is looking out
of the window and Ross is handing out some Chinese takeout.  There's a small SAP in
the corner of the screen.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Aqui está. (Here it is!)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ¿A quién pidio el pollo General Tso? (Who ordered General Sal's chicken?)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ¡Pudo aver sido General Tso! (It could've been General Sal!)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ¡Mira, mira, el viejo desnudo está haciendo el hula hoop! (Look, look, Ugly Naked Guy is doing the hula!)

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: ¡Ewww! (Ewww!)

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: ¡Hola, Joey! (Hi, Joey!)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ¡Hola, amigos! (Hey, everybody!)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mira, Ross, Marcel se llevo el control remoto. (Look, Ross, Marcel's got the remote.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ¡Lo que sucedio es que no le gusta la tele! (The thing is, he doesn`t like the program!)
